parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description:
Foundry Project endpoint in the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/{project-name}".
If you only have one Project in your Foundry Hub, or to target the default Project
in your Hub, use the form
"https://{ai-services-account-name}.services.ai.azure.com/api/projects/_project"

get.description: List all connections in the project, without populating connection credentials

parameters.description: List connections of this specific type

values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with container not specified (used by Agents)

get.description: List evaluations for a project.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last run from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of runs to retrieve.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order for runs by timestamp. Use `asc` for ascending order or `desc` for descending order. Defaults to `asc`.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
Evals can be ordered by creation time or last updated time. Use
`created_at` for creation time or `updated_at` for last updated time.

schema.description: The response data for a requested list of items.

first_id.description: The first ID represented in this list.

last_id.description: The last ID represented in this list.

has_more.description: A value indicating whether there are additional values available not captured in this list.

post.description:
Create the structure of an evaluation that can be used to test a model's performance.
An evaluation is a set of testing criteria and the config for a data source, which dictates the schema of the data used in the evaluation. After creating an evaluation, you can run it on different models and model parameters. We support several types of graders and datasources.
For more information, see the [Evals guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/evals).

parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

riskCategories.description: List of risk categories to evaluate against.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

target.description: The target of the error, if applicable.

AssetCredentialResponse.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobReference.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

values.name: Easy
values.description: Represents a default set of easy complexity attacks. Easy complexity attacks require less effort, such as translation of a prompt into some encoding, and does not require any Large Language Model to convert or orchestrate.

values.name: Moderate
values.description: Represents a default set of moderate complexity attacks. Moderate complexity attacks require having access to resources such as another generative AI model.

values.name: Difficult
values.description: Represents a default set of difficult complexity attacks. Difficult complexity attacks include attacks that require access to significant resources and effort to execute an attack such as knowledge of search-based algorithms in addition to a generative AI model.

values.name: AsciiArt
values.description: Generates visual art using ASCII characters, often used for creative or obfuscation purposes.

values.name: AsciiSmuggler
values.description: Conceals data within ASCII characters, making it harder to detect.

values.name: Atbash
values.description: Implements the Atbash cipher, a simple substitution cipher where each letter is mapped to its reverse.

values.name: Base64
values.description: Encodes binary data into a text format using Base64, commonly used for data transmission.

values.name: Binary
values.description: Converts text into binary code, representing data in a series of 0s and 1s.

values.name: Caesar
values.description: Applies the Caesar cipher, a substitution cipher that shifts characters by a fixed number of positions.

values.name: CharacterSpace
values.description: Alters text by adding spaces between characters, often used for obfuscation.

values.name: Jailbreak
values.description: Injects specially crafted prompts to bypass AI safeguards, known as User Injected Prompt Attacks (UPIA).

values.name: AnsiiAttack
values.description: Utilizes ANSI escape sequences to manipulate text appearance and behavior.

values.name: CharacterSwap
values.description: Swaps characters within text to create variations or obfuscate the original content.

values.name: SuffixAppend
values.description: Appends an adversarial suffix to the prompt.

values.name: StringJoin
values.description: Joins multiple strings together, often used for concatenation or obfuscation.

values.name: UnicodeConfusable
values.description: Uses Unicode characters that look similar to standard characters, creating visual confusion.

values.name: UnicodeSubstitution
values.description: Substitutes standard characters with Unicode equivalents, often for obfuscation.

values.name: Diacritic
values.description: Adds diacritical marks to characters, changing their appearance and sometimes their meaning.

values.name: Flip
values.description: Flips characters from front to back, creating a mirrored effect.

values.name: Leetspeak
values.description: Transforms text into Leetspeak, a form of encoding that replaces letters with similar-looking numbers or symbols.

values.name: ROT13
values.description: Applies the ROT13 cipher, a simple substitution cipher that shifts characters by 13 positions.

values.name: Morse
values.description: Encodes text into Morse code, using dots and dashes to represent characters.

values.name: Baseline
values.description: Represents the baseline direct adversarial probing, which is used by attack strategies as the attack objective.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

values.name: Canceled
values.description: The operation has been canceled by the user.

AzureAIAgentTarget.description: Represents a target specifying an Azure AI agent.

name.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI agent.

version.description: The version of the Azure AI agent.

tool_descriptions.description: The parameters used to control the sampling behavior of the agent during text generation.

AzureAIAgentTargetUpdate.description: Represents a target specifying an Azure AI agent.

name.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI agent.

version.description: The version of the Azure AI agent.

tool_descriptions.description: The parameters used to control the sampling behavior of the agent during text generation.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI Assistant.

tool_descriptions.description: The descriptions of tools available to the assistant.

AzureAIAssistantTargetUpdate.description: Represents a target specifying an Azure AI Assistant (Agent V1) endpoint, including its id.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI Assistant.

tool_descriptions.description: The descriptions of tools available to the assistant.

AzureAIModelTarget.description: Represents a target specifying an Azure AI model for operations requiring model selection.

model.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI model.

sampling_params.description: The parameters used to control the sampling behavior of the model during text generation.

AzureAIModelTargetUpdate.description: Represents a target specifying an Azure AI model for operations requiring model selection.

model.description: The unique identifier of the Azure AI model.

sampling_params.description: The parameters used to control the sampling behavior of the model during text generation.

connectionName.description: Name of connection to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

AzureOpenAIModelConfiguration.description: Azure OpenAI model configuration. The API version would be selected by the service for querying the model.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name for AOAI model. Example: gpt-4o if in AIServices or connection based `connection_name/deployment_name` (e.g. `my-aoai-connection/gpt-4o`).

BaseCredentials.description: A base class for connection credentials

type.description: The type of credential used by the connection

blobUri.description: Blob URI path for client to upload data. Example: https://blob.windows.core.net/Container/Path

storageAccountArmId.description: ARM ID of the storage account to use.

credential.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

clusters.description: List of clusters identified in the insights.

coordinates.description:
Optional mapping of IDs to 2D coordinates used by the UX for visualization.

  The map keys are string identifiers (for example, a cluster id or a sample id)
  and the values are the coordinates and visual size for rendering on a 2D chart.

  This property is omitted unless the client requests coordinates (for example,
  by passing `includeCoordinates=true` as a query parameter).

  Example:
  {
    "cluster-1": { "x": 12, "y": 34, "size": 8 },
    "sample-123": { "x": 18, "y": 22, "size": 4 }
  }

  Coordinates are intended only for client-side visualization and do not
  modify the canonical insights results.

CodeBasedEvaluatorDefinition.description: Code-based evaluator definition using python code

code_text.description: Inline code text for the evaluator

Connection.description: Response from the list and get connections operations

id.description: A unique identifier for the connection, generated by the service

target.description: The connection URL to be used for this service

isDefault.description: Whether the connection is tagged as the default connection of its type

credentials.description: The credentials used by the connection

ConnectionType.description: The Type (or category) of the connection

values.name: AzureBlobStorage
values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with specified container

values.name: AzureStorageAccount
values.description: Azure Blob Storage, with container not specified (used by Agents)

values.name: APIKey
values.description: Generic connection that uses API Key authentication

ContinuousEvaluationRuleAction.description: Evaluation rule action for continuous evaluation.

evalId.description: Eval Id to add continuous evaluation runs to.

maxHourlyRuns.description: Maximum number of evaluation runs allowed per hour.

data_source_config.description: The configuration for the data source used for the evaluation runs. Dictates the schema of the data used in the evaluation.

testing_criteria.description: A list of graders for all eval runs in this group. Graders can reference variables in the data source using double curly braces notation, like `{{item.variable_name}}`. To reference the model's output, use the `sample` namespace (ie, `{{sample.output_text}}`).

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.

CredentialType.description: The credential type used by the connection

values.name: entraId
values.description: Entra ID credential (formerly known as AAD)

expression.description: Cron expression that defines the schedule frequency.

timeZone.description: Time zone for the cron schedule.

startTime.description: Start time for the cron schedule in ISO 8601 format.

endTime.description: End time for the cron schedule in ISO 8601 format.

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

isReference.description: Indicates if the dataset holds a reference to the storage, or the dataset manages storage itself. If true, the underlying data will not be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

connectionName.description: The Azure Storage Account connection name. Required if startPendingUploadVersion was not called before creating the Dataset

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

deleted.description: Whether the eval was successfully deleted.
Whether the eval was successfully deleted.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name of embedding model. It can point to a model deployment either in the parent AIServices or a connection.

Eval.title: Eval
Eval.description:
An Eval object with a data source config and testing criteria.
An Eval represents a task to be done for your LLM integration.
Like:
- Improve the quality of my chatbot
- See how well my chatbot handles customer support
- Check if o4-mini is better at my usecase than gpt-4o

data_source_config.description: Configuration of data sources used in runs of the evaluation.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the eval was created.

modified_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was last modified.

created_by.description: the name of the person who created the run.

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval object

comparisons.description: Comparison results for each treatment run against the baseline.

method.description: The statistical method used for comparison.

passed.description: indicates if the check passed or failed

EvalRun.title: EvalRun
EvalRun.description: A schema representing an evaluation run.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the associated evaluation.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

model.description: The model that is evaluated, if applicable.

name.description: The name of the evaluation run.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

report_url.description: The URL to the rendered evaluation run report on the UI dashboard.

result_counts.description: Counters summarizing the outcomes of the evaluation run.

per_model_usage.description: Usage statistics for each model during the evaluation run.

per_testing_criteria_results.description: Results per testing criteria applied during the evaluation run.

data_source.description: Information about the run's data source.

modified_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was last modified.

created_by.description: the name of the person who created the run.

properties.description:
Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run object

EvalRunOutputItem.title: EvalRunOutputItem
EvalRunOutputItem.description: A schema representing an evaluation run output item.

object.description: The type of the object. Always "eval.run.output_item".

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation run output item.

run_id.description: The identifier of the evaluation run associated with this output item.

eval_id.description: The identifier of the evaluation group.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the evaluation run was created.

status.description: The status of the evaluation run.

datasource_item_id.description: The identifier for the data source item.

datasource_item.description: Details of the input data source item.

results.description: A list of grader results for this output item.

sample.description: A sample containing the input and output of the evaluation run.

x-oaiMeta.name: The eval run output item object

EvalRunOutputItemResult.title: EvalRunOutputItemResult
EvalRunOutputItemResult.description: A single grader result for an evaluation run output item.

score.description: The numeric score produced by the grader.

passed.description: Whether the grader considered the output a pass.

sample.description: Optional sample or intermediate data produced by the grader.

label.description: The label associated with the test criteria metric (e.g., "pass", "fail", "good", "bad").

threshold.description: The threshold used to determine pass/fail for this test criteria, if it is numerical.

reason.description: The reason for the test criteria metric.

properties.description: Additional details about the test criteria metric.

EvalRunResultCompareItem.description: Metric comparison for a treatment against the baseline.

treatmentRunSummary.description: Summary statistics of the treatment run.

deltaEstimate.description: Estimated difference between treatment and baseline.

EvalRunResultComparison.description: Comparison results for treatment runs against the baseline.

evaluator.description: Name of the evaluator for this testing criteria.

baselineRunSummary.description: Summary statistics of the baseline run.

compareItems.description: List of comparison results for each treatment run.

EvalRunResultSummary.description: Summary statistics of a metric in an evaluation run.

sampleCount.description: Number of samples in the evaluation run.

average.description: Average value of the metric in the evaluation run.

standardDeviation.description: Standard deviation of the metric in the evaluation run.

baselineRunId.description: The baseline run ID for comparison.

treatmentRunIds.description: List of treatment run IDs for comparison.

EvaluationResultSample.description: A sample from the evaluation result.

evaluationResult.description: Evaluation result for the analysis sample.

id.description: Unique identifier for the evaluation rule.

displayName.description: Display Name for the evaluation rule.

action.description: Definition of the evaluation rule action.

filter.description: Filter condition of the evaluation rule.

eventType.description: Event type that the evaluation rule applies to.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the evaluation rule is enabled. Default is true.

systemData.description: System metadata for the evaluation rule.

EvaluationRuleEventType.description: Type of the evaluation rule event.

EvaluationRunClusterInsightResult.description: Insights from the evaluation run cluster analysis.

EvaluationRunClusterInsightsRequest.description: Insights on set of Evaluation Results

runIds.description: List of evaluation run IDs for the insights.

modelConfiguration.description: Configuration of the model used in the insight generation.

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

taxonomyInput.description: Input configuration for the evaluation taxonomy.

properties.description: Additional properties for the evaluation taxonomy.

type.description: Input type of the evaluation taxonomy.

type.description: Input type of the evaluation taxonomy.

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

taxonomyInput.description: Input configuration for the evaluation taxonomy.

properties.description: Additional properties for the evaluation taxonomy.

init_parameters.description: The JSON schema (Draft 2020-12) for the evaluator's input parameters. This includes parameters like type, properties, required.

data_schema.description: The JSON schema (Draft 2020-12) for the evaluator's input data. This includes parameters like type, properties, required.

metrics.description: List of output metrics produced by this evaluator

desirable_direction.description: It indicates whether a higher value is better or a lower value is better for this metric.

max_value.description: Maximum value for the metric. If not specified, it is assumed to be unbounded.

is_primary.description: Indicates if this metric is primary when there are multiple metrics.

EvaluatorMetricDirection.description: The direction of the metric indicating whether a higher value is better, a lower value is better, or neutral

values.name: increase
values.description: It indicates a higher value is better for this metric

values.name: decrease
values.description: It indicates a lower value is better for this metric

values.name: neutral
values.description: It indicates no preference for this metric direction

values.name: ordinal
values.description: Ordinal metric representing categories that can be ordered or ranked.

values.name: continuous
values.description: Continuous metric representing values in a continuous range.

display_name.description: Display Name for evaluator. It helps to find the evaluator easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

modified_at.description: Last modified date/time of the evaluator

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

contentFields.description: List of fields with text content

filepathField.description: Path of file to be used as a source of text content

titleField.description: Field containing the title of the document

urlField.description: Field containing the url of the document

vectorFields.description: List of fields with vector content

metadataFields.description: List of fields with metadata content

HumanEvaluationRuleAction.description: Evaluation rule action for human evaluation.

id.description: Asset ID, a unique identifier for the asset

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

Insight.description: The response body for cluster insights.

id.description: The unique identifier for the insights report.

state.description: The current state of the insights.

displayName.description: User friendly display name for the insight.

result.description: The result of the insights report.

id.description: The id of the analysis cluster.

weight.description: The weight of the analysis cluster. This indicate number of samples in the cluster.

subClusters.description: List of subclusters within this cluster. Empty if no subclusters exist.

samples.description: List of samples that belong to this cluster. Empty if samples are part of subclusters.

InsightModelConfiguration.description: Configuration of the model used in the insight generation.

modelDeploymentName.description: The model deployment to be evaluated. Accepts either the deployment name alone or with the connection name as '{connectionName}/<modelDeploymentName>'.

InsightRequest.description: The request of the insights report.

id.description: The unique identifier for the analysis sample.

features.description: Features to help with additional filtering of data in UX.

correlationInfo.description: Info about the correlation for the analysis sample.

uniqueSubclusterCount.description: Total number of unique subcluster labels.

usage.description: Token usage while performing clustering analysis

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the insights were completed.

OpenAI.Metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

value.description: The Connection items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PendingUploadRequest.description: Represents a request for a pending upload.

pendingUploadId.description: If PendingUploadId is not provided, a random GUID will be used.

connectionName.description: Azure Storage Account connection name to use for generating temporary SAS token

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type.

PendingUploadResponse.description: Represents the response for a pending upload request

version.description: Version of asset to be created if user did not specify version when initially creating upload

pendingUploadType.description: BlobReference is the only supported type

prompt_text.description: The prompt text used for evaluation

type.description: Recurrence type for the recurrence schedule.

startTime.description: Start time for the recurrence schedule in ISO 8601 format.

endTime.description: End time for the recurrence schedule in ISO 8601 format.

timeZone.description: Time zone for the recurrence schedule.

schedule.description: Recurrence schedule for the recurrence trigger.

id.description: Identifier of the red team run.

attackStrategies.description: List of attack strategies or nested lists of attack strategies.

simulationOnly.description: Simulation-only or Simulation + Evaluation. Default false, if true the scan outputs conversation not evaluation result.

riskCategories.description: List of risk categories to generate attack objectives for.

applicationScenario.description: Application scenario for the red team operation, to generate scenario specific attacks.

tags.description: Red team's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Red team's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

status.description: Status of the red-team. It is set by service and is read-only.

target.description: Target configuration for the red-team run.

RiskCategory.description: Risk category for the attack objective.

values.name: HateUnfairness
values.description: Represents content related to hate or unfairness.

values.name: Sexual
values.description: Represents content of a sexual nature.

SampleType.description: The type of sample used in the analysis.

values.name: EvaluationResultSample
values.description: A sample from the evaluation result.

tags.description: Schedule's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Schedule's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

values.name: Creating
values.description: Represents the creation status of the schedule.

values.name: Updating
values.description: Represents the updating status of the schedule.

values.name: Deleting
values.description: Represents the deleting status of the schedule.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: Represents the succeeded status of the schedule.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Represents the failed status of the schedule.

success.description: Trigger success status of the schedule run.

triggerTime.description: Trigger time of the schedule run.

error.description: Error information for the schedule run.

Target.description: Base class for targets with discriminator support.

TargetUpdate.description: Base class for targets with discriminator support.

id.description: Unique identifier of the taxonomy category.

riskCategory.description: Risk category associated with this taxonomy category.

properties.description: Additional properties for the taxonomy category.

id.description: Unique identifier of the taxonomy sub-category.

enabled.description: List of taxonomy items under this sub-category.

properties.description: Additional properties for the taxonomy sub-category.

ToolDescription.description: Description of a tool that can be used by an agent.

description.description: A brief description of the tool's purpose.

values.name: TooFewSamples
values.description: Not enough samples to determine treatment effect.

values.name: Inconclusive
values.description: No significant difference between treatment and baseline.

values.name: Changed
values.description: Indicates the metric changed with statistical significance, but the direction is neutral.

values.name: Improved
values.description: Indicates the treatment significantly improved the metric compared to baseline.

values.name: Degraded
values.description: Indicates the treatment significantly degraded the metric compared to baseline.

Set of immutable 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object for storing additional information.
    Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.
